name: UPI / QR Refund Scam Lab
summary: Experience a WhatsApp conversation where a 'customer support' agent sends you a QR code to 'receive' a refund. This is one of India's most common scams.

messages.text: Hello sir, I am calling from ABC Store customer support. Our records show that you were charged twice for your recent order.
We sincerely apologize for this inconvenience. To process your refund of Rs. 4,999 immediately, please scan the QR code I am sending.
Sir, I am on shift closing in 2 minutes. If you don't scan now, the refund request will be cancelled and you will have to wait 7-10 business days for manual processing.

quickReplies.text: Why do I need to scan QR to receive money?
No, I will wait for normal refund.

qr.note: Refund for double charge - Scan to receive

upiApproval.message: You are PAYING Rs. 4,999 to XYZ STORE. Enter UPI PIN to confirm.

traps.description: You agreed to scan a QR code to 'receive' money without questioning the process.
You scanned a QR code thinking you would receive money.
You approved a payment to the scammer instead of receiving money.
You questioned why scanning a QR is needed to receive money.
You refused to scan and decided to wait for the normal refund process.
You cancelled the UPI payment after seeing the confirmation screen.

realWorldConsequences: The money would instantly leave your account and go to the scammer – UPI transactions are irreversible.
Scammers who get your UPI PIN can potentially make multiple transactions before you realize.
If you share your UPI PIN on call or screen share, scammers can empty your entire account.
Some scammers use this access to take instant loans in your name, leaving you with debt.
Your bank cannot reverse UPI payments made with your PIN – you authorized the transaction.
preventionTips: GOLDEN RULE: To RECEIVE money by UPI, you NEVER need to enter your UPI PIN. PIN is only for SENDING money.
QR codes are used to PAY someone, not to receive money. Don't scan QR codes from unknown sources.
Always read the UPI confirmation screen carefully – it clearly shows if you are PAYING or RECEIVING.
Legitimate refunds are processed automatically by companies – you don't need to 'do' anything to receive them.
If someone pressures you with 'time running out' or 'shift ending', it's almost definitely a scam.
Never share your UPI PIN, OTP, or CVV with anyone – not even bank employees or customer support.

redFlagHints.agreed-to-scan: Legitimate refunds don't require you to scan anything. The company processes refunds on their end.
redFlagHints.scanned-qr-to-receive: UPI QR codes are designed for PAYMENTS. There's no such thing as a 'receive money' QR code.
redFlagHints.approved-upi-payment: The UPI screen clearly showed 'You are PAYING Rs. 4,999' – but urgency made you ignore it.
redFlagHints.questioned-process: Asking questions is the right approach. Scammers rely on people not questioning their stories.
redFlagHints.resisted-pressure: You didn't give in to the urgency and pressure tactics – this is excellent scam awareness.
redFlagHints.declined-upi: You read the confirmation screen and caught the scam at the last moment – well done!
